question: What happens if you putt your ball and it hits another player's ball that was already on the green?*

choices.text: You get a trophy for hitting the other ball.
Nothing, you just keep playing as if it didn't happen.
You get a two-stroke penalty because you caused a collision.
Your opponent has to replace their ball to the location where it was before you ball hit it

explanation: In stroke play, hitting another player's ball on the green with your putt incurs a two-stroke penalty. You must replace the moved ball to where it was before being hit. In match play, there's no penalty unless done intentionally. It is your responsibility to ask the player to mark their ball if it is in your way.
